intro: Talipariti crestaense, commonly known as the crested talipariti, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, palm-like leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
